alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Stewart and southwestern Webster Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Sanford, or 7 miles southwest of Lumpkin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Richland, Weston, Troutman, Kimbrough, Sanford, Westville and Leveretts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
